creator: gunnar.ellen.1@telia.com
text:
The "quiet" option only supresses some of the "Deleting..." messages. Most of
the calls to log doesn't pass a verbosity parameter. This results in many
confusing messages in big scripts that create and delete a lot of temporary files.

creator: kevin.jackson@it.fts-vn.com
text:
Created attachment 16432
Uses verbosity to supress messages when quiet selected

- attempts to supress logging verbosity when quiet option chosen
- use local variable to store filesets size instead of looking up each time

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text: The patch is incompatible with the latest Delete code.

Sorry I did run CVS update first before working on the patch.  I'll try to make
sure that I'm working against HEAD next time.  My bad.

Kev
creator: kevin.jackson@it.fts-vn.com

text: hmm, you know we're on SVN now, right?
creator: mbenson@apache.org
kevin.jackson@it.fts-vn.com
text:
Yeah I did, I actually expected CVS update to fail, but it still ran (do we have
an old version lingering in CVS?).  I assumed as it still ran, that the CVS
version was a mirror of the SVN version whilst the SVN version was being tested
(run the old system for a couple of weeks/months in parallel with the new system
in case of problems).

I now know better.

I'll get onto fixing this as soon as my machine is setup correctly, unless of
course the Delete task has already been fixed to be quiet in all cases, then I
won't bother ;)
